trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref>-derived objects that are used by data source controls in advanced data-binding scenarios.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects used in advanced data-binding scenarios with data source controls.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects are used to bind the values contained by local <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> variables, HTTP cookies, session variables, and other controls' values to data source controls when retrieving, updating, deleting, and inserting data.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> class to programmatically manage a set of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects.
You can add, insert, and remove <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects using the appropriate methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> class.
To programmatically retrieve <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects from a collection, use one of following methods:
Use the indexer to get a single <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object from the collection, by name or using array notation.

Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Count%2A> property specifies the total number of items in the collection, and is used to determine the upper bound of the collection.

You can add and remove items from the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Insert%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods.

Depending on the implementation and the semantics of a particular data source control, the order in which the parameters are stored in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection might be important.

For example, when using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control as an ODBC data source, the order of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection must be the same as the order of the parameters in the parameterized SQL queries you use.
However, when using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control with Microsoft SQL Server, the order of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects are not important.
When you use data source controls, values are inserted into command parameters without validation, which is a potential security threat.
Use an event in the data source control to validate parameter values before the command is executed.
For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/772c7312-211a-4eb3-8d6e-eec0aa1dcc07).
The following table lists the different parameter classes and how they are used.
Parameter Class
Description
The base parameter class.
Use it to bind to a local variable or any static string using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property.
A parameter that can be used to bind to a control's property or method return value.
A parameter that can be used to bind to the value of a cookie.
A parameter that can be used to bind to an attribute of the current Web Forms page.
A parameter that can be used to bind to a value passed to a Web Forms page on a query string.
A parameter that can be used to bind to the value of a session variable.
A parameter that can be used to bind to the value of an ASP.NET Profile property.
Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance.
This constructor can be called only by an inherited class.
Appends the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object to the end of the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Add%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter%29> method to append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object to the end of the collection.
This implementation of the method takes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object specified by the `param` parameter and appends it to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to append to the collection.
The index value of the added item.
Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object with the specified name and default value, and appends it to the end of the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Add%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> method to create and append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object with a default value to the end of the collection.

This implementation of the method creates the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object using the name and default value specified by the `name` and `value` parameters, respectively, and appends it to the collection.
The name of the parameter.
A string that serves as a default value for the parameter.
The index value of the added item.
Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object with the specified name, database type, and default value, and adds it to the end of the collection.
This method is for database types.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Add%28System.String%2CSystem.TypeCode%2CSystem.String%29> method for CLR types.
The name of the parameter.
The database type of the parameter.
The default value for the parameter.
The index value of the added item.

Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object with the specified name, <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref>, and default value, and appends it to the end of the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Add%28System.String%2CSystem.TypeCode%2CSystem.String%29> method to create and append a strongly typed <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object with a default value to the end of the collection.

This implementation of the method creates the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object using the name, type and value specified by the `name`, `type` and `value` parameters, respectively, and appends it to the collection.
The name of the parameter.
The type of the parameter.
The default value for the parameter.
The index value of the added item.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref> collection contains a specific value
Use this method to determine whether a specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object is in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the object is found in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
If `null` is passed for the value parameter, `false` is returned.
Copies a specified index of a parameter array to the parameter collection.
Parameter array from which the value at a specified index is to be copied from.
The `integer` index of the parameterArray item that is to be copied.
Creates an instance of a default <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.CreateKnownType%2A> method creates an instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object according to the index of the <xref:System.Type> returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.GetKnownTypes%2A> method.
The index values correspond to types shown in the following table.
Index
Parameter type

The index of the type of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to create from the ordered list of types returned by <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.GetKnownTypes"></xref>.
A default instance of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref>.
The specified index is not within the recognized range.
Gets an array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> types that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref> collection can contain.
An ordered array of <xref href="System.Type"></xref> objects that identify the types of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> objects that the collection can contain.
Gets an ordered collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object names and their corresponding values currently contained by the collection.

The `control` parameter is used by <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects contained in the collection to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> and current <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest> object that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object binds to.

Because the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object must have uniquely named entries but the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection does not require or guarantee unique <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object names, the implementation of this method appends a number to the end of each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A> property to ensure uniqueness in the returned collection.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest"></xref> that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> binds to.

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> instance that is passed to each parameter's <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ControlParameter.Evaluate(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Web.UI.Control)"></xref> method.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> of name/value pairs.
Determines the index of a specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref> collection.
Use this method to determine the index of a parameter in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref>.
The index of parameter, if it is found in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref> collection at the specified index.
The zero-based index at which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> is inserted.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to insert.
index is less than zero.
-or-
index is greater than `Count`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object with the specified name in the collection.
Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object by name from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection, using array notation.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> with the specified name in the collection.
If the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> is not found in the collection, the indexer returns `null`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.
Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object by its location in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
Performs additional custom processes after clearing the contents of the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnClearComplete%2A> method is called to perform additional processing after the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear%2A> method completes.
It calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnParametersChanged%2A> method.
Occurs before the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Insert(System.Int32,System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter)"></xref> method is called.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnInsert%2A> method is called to perform additional processing before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Insert%2A> method is called.
The index in the collection that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> is inserted at.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> that is inserted into the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref>.
Occurs after the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Insert(System.Int32,System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter)"></xref> method completes.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnInsertComplete%2A> method is called to perform additional processing after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Insert%2A> method completes.
It calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnParametersChanged%2A> method.
The index in the collection that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> was inserted at.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> that was inserted into the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.ParametersChanged"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs after the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Remove(System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter)"></xref> method completes.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnRemoveComplete%2A> method is called to perform additional processing after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.Remove%2A> method completes.
It calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnParametersChanged%2A> method.
The index in the collection that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> was removed from.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> that was removed from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref>.
Performs additional custom processes when validating a value.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnValidate%2A> method determines whether the object specified in the `o` parameter is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> instance.
If not, it throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception.
The `object` being validated.
The object is not an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> class or one of its derived classes.
The object is `null`.
Occurs when one or more <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> objects contained by the collection changes state.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection is contained by a data source control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.ParametersChanged> event raises the data source control's `DataSourceChanged` event, causing any data-bound controls to rebind.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref> collection.
Use this method to remove the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref>.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object at the specified index from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref> collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object at the specified index from the collection.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to remove.
Marks the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object as having changed since the last load or save from view state.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.SetDirtyObject%2A> method is a helper function that is used to mark a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object as having changed since the last load or save from view state.
This method is used only by control developers.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> to mark as having changed since the last load or save from view state.
Iterates through the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> objects contained by the collection, and calls the `Evaluate` method on each one.

The `control` parameter is used by <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects contained in the collection to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> and current <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest> object that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object binds to.

If the current value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object is different from the value cached in view state, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method is called.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest"></xref> that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> binds to.

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> instance that is passed to each parameter's <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ControlParameter.Evaluate(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Web.UI.Control)"></xref> method.
